p: Sulfated polysaccharides are gaining contemporary significance and acts as good anticoagulant drugs when compared to traditional treatment methods using heparin. The anticoagulant activity of natural (P3a) and its sulfated derivative (SP3a) was measured in vitro by APTT, TT and PT analysis. Heparin a known commercially available anticoagulant was used as a positive control. Functional tests that can detect clump formation are APTT, PT and TT analysis which can assess blood clot formation and assess the intrinsic, extrinsic and third clotting stages in plasma ( Leadley etÂ al., 2000).
